#### These are problem instances with 'optimal/close to optimal' solution provided.
#### You can use these to test the quality of the solution obtained by your algorithm.
#### m: 'types' of stock lengths, n: 'types' of pieces required.

#Problem 1:
m: 3
n: 8
Stock lengths: 10, 13, 15
Stock costs: 100, 130, 150
Piece lengths: 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10
Quantities:    5, 2, 1, 2, 4, 2, 1, 3

#### Solution cost: 1240
------------------------------------------------------------

#Problem 2:
m: 8
n: 18
Stock lengths: 4300, 4250, 4150, 3950, 3800, 3700, 3550, 3500
Stock costs: 86, 85, 83, 79, 68, 66, 64, 63
Piece lengths: 2350, 2250, 2200, 2100, 2050, 2000, 1950, 1900, 1850, 1700, 1650, 1350, 1300, 1250, 1200, 1150, 1100, 1050
Quantities:    2, 4, 4, 15, 6, 11, 6, 15, 13, 5, 2, 9, 3, 6, 10, 4, 8, 3

#### Solution cost: 3998
